segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes like she’s in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring out of the sink, and she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy on that wobbly stool, and I’m scared he’s going to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie, not even caring about the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is so focused on her task that she doesn’t see the puddle forming around her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is just pouring water, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the boy’s hand reaching deeper into the cookie jar, and I wonder if he’ll ever stop.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice, but inside, it’s like a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the girl’s hand is open, waiting for a cookie like she doesn’t have a care in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to slip and fall any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading, and the cabinets are getting ruined.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everyone is acting in this situation.
segments.speaker: PAR
